cs.IT, cs.CR, cs.DM, cs.CC, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the construction of minimal linear codes, which is a topic in information theory (cs.IT) and cryptography (cs.CR). The use of characteristic functions is a technique commonly used in discrete mathematics (cs.DM) and coding theory (cs.IT). The paper also mentions secret sharing schemes and secure two-party computation, which are topics in computer security (cs.CR) and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the paper presents a characterization of minimal linear codes from the defining set method, which is a topic in coding theory (cs.IT) and combinatorics (cs.DM).
